intro: Randia cumingiana, commonly known as the Cuming's randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature. Randia cumingiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
